000.title: SISTEM Opening
000.description: A welcome from this years SISTEM conference team!

005.title: Closing Remarks
005.description: The sad moment where we close off SISTEM for another year!

101.title: An Introduction to SRE: Site Reliability Engineering
101.description:
In this talk, Michael Mullen and Forum Mehta will be talking all about Site-Reliability Engineering including topics related to:
• Using SLIs and SLOs to measure user happiness.
• Error budgets.
• Difference between SRE and SWE work.
• The major aspects of SRE culture.
• An overview of technical opportunities at Google

103.title: Me, Myself and The Tech Community
103.description: Take a journey with Vicky on how she got involved with the tech community and why community not only important for her, but for people curious about technology, and especially for those studying and interested in having a career in the industry.

104.title: Speedrunning Management
104.description: How did I go from a lowly engineer to a Sigma Manager Elite? Come with me to the 3-month crucible of my first managerial position, the problems I inherited and the tools I used to solve them. Management is more than just spreadsheets and reports, there’s a psychology, and deliberate methodology, to team dynamics and how we deliver work. Tune in and discover a whole new area of engineering you may have never even considered.

106.title: Building Things For Fun & Occasional Profit
106.description: James will discuss the journey of building CoderDojo and his newest venture Conjure, with an emphasis on refining your skills, not burning out and enjoying the adventure… he'll also share all the times he did none of that and burnt out.

301.title: Accenture Workshop | That wasn’t very data- driven of you
301.description: Data, it's everywhere. The sheer volumes of untapped / unanalysed data surrounding us in our daily lives, can tell us a lot when collected, analysed and interpreted. This workshop will be a crash course into all things data with a focus on analytics and visualisation. We’ll be discussing the basic principles and processes in these areas, and how broad and interesting the field is for both technical and non-technical people alike. “Data is like people – interrogate it hard enough and it will tell you whatever you want to hear” - Christopher Doyle

304.title: Red Hat Workshop | Delivering an AI scheduling application in 60 days
304.description: Have you ever wondered what an actual project looks like and how it's being implemented from idea to delivery? In this workshop, we will give you an insight into how Red Hat delivered an AI scheduling application from idea to roll out in just 60 days.

evan_smith.bio: Evan Smith is an SRE Manager for the Release Engineering team at Squarespace, and is responsible for the development and deployment experience of hundreds of engineers every day. He believes strongly in a human-centric approach to management and kind engineering.
evan_smith.name: Evan Smith

evan_smith.title: SRE Manager

james_whelton.bio: James is an entrepreneur and software developer from Cork. In 2011 aged 18, he co-founded CoderDojo, a movement of over 2300 free coding clubs for young people across over 110 countries. James has worked in CTO and private equity roles across the Middle East, Japan and USA. Currently James is building Conjure.so, a platform for behaviour change and achievement. James is passionate about self development and well-being, having tested every method possible to burn himself out.
james_whelton.name: James Whelton
james_whelton.shortBio: James is an entrepreneur and software developer from Cork. In 2011 aged 18, he co-founded CoderDojo...
james_whelton.title: Software Developer

vicky_twomey-lee.bio: Vicky is a coder, a tech event organiser, and advocates diversity in tech in her free time. She currently works part-time at Yard.live as their Community Lead (Resident Tech Mystic 🦄). She has been involved with the Python community since 2005, and has recently been awarded Community Spirit Awards by Python Software Foundation and EuroPython Society Fellows Award for her contribution to the Python community which includes Python Ireland, PyCon Ireland and PyLadies Dublin.

michael_mullen.bio: Michael has been with Google fulltime since graduating from UCD Computer Science in 2019. Before that, he interned twice, once in Dublin with Hardware Ops SRE and once in Mountain View, California with the Payments team as a SWE. He works as an SRE with the Search Frontend team, keeping results reliable and users happy for Google's flagship product.

valerie_oyiki.bio: Valerie is a UX/UI Designer and cofounder of Black Girls in Tech. She cares about opening more black women up to the career opportunities that lie in technology and making the industry a safer and more equitable environment for black women to thrive in.
valerie_oyiki.name: Valerie Oyiki

nadia_alramli.bio: Nadia Alramli is a Senior Director of Engineering at HubSpot, a marketing, sales, and service software company that helps businesses grow. She started her career working in the video games industry building backend services for the Call of Duty Franchise for over a decade before moving to HubSpot. Nadia knew she wanted to pursue a career in technology from the moment she first saw a computer at the age of sixteen. She was one of the first classes to ever graduate from Computer Science in Syria. She also has a Master’s in Software Engineering from University College Dublin. In her spare time, Nadia can be found crocheting miniature animals, or playing with squirrels in nearby parks.

chloe_thompson.bio: Chloe is a Cognitive Science Engineer who recently graduated from Queen's University Belfast with a Master's degree in Software and Electronic Systems Engineering. She is passionate about all things AI/ML, Data analytics and research into new technology. Chloe is currently the director of Women Who Code Belfast, a Rural Ireland Tech Advocate and an organiser of Artificial Intelligence NI. She is enthusiastic about event organisation and the local tech community. She has a love for coffee after spending many years as a barista and prides herself on her talent of making a good flat white.

karen_emelu.bio: My name is Karen, a multifaceted individual with a curious mind. As a senior product designer I love creating extraordinary meaningful user experiences through design and I am passionate about how those experiences influence others. I am the Founder of Black Girls in Tech, which is an organisation that cultivates/supports black women getting into technology all over the world. One thing I am extremely passionate about is increasing the representation of black women in the technology field and helping women get started on their tech journey.

poppi_datta.bio: Poppi Datta (she/her) originally joined IBM as a placement intern, but returned as a fully fledged graduate cybersecurity software engineer at IBM in 2020. Her focus in her day job is on quality assurance, working on IBM’s SIEM product QRadar. She is also passionate about diversity and inclusion; and participates in a number of voluntary side roles within IBM’s LGBTQ+ business resource group.

niamh_phillips.bio: Hi There, my name is Niamh Phillips, I am a Senior Business & Integration Arch Analyst within Accenture with a Computer Science degree from Queen’s University Belfast . I work within the wonderful world of data analysis and focus the majority of my time in design and visualization, I help businesses harness and transform the data they are collecting to provide insightful information in a creative, effective and eye-catching manner. I hope to further develop and utilize my skills in this area throughout my professional career and am delighted to be a part of this year's SISTEM Conference and share my love of all things data.

ashleigh_lemon.bio: Hello! My name is Ashleigh Lemon, I am an Application Development Analyst at Accenture. I studied Computing Technologies at Ulster University. I am currently working in the Health & Public sector. My role is within Application Support. I work within a wide range of areas such as development, Azure Cloud, Technical Architecture & Devops. I have an interest in Data Analytics & Statistical modeling. My goal is to develop these skills throughout my time at Accenture and dive into the wonders of Data!

thomas_cashman.bio: Thomas has over a decade technical experience building game engines, telecom systems and compilers. He specializes in high-performance and high-reliability. In 2017 he bootstrapped Viridian Software and has grown it into a game technology studio that focuses new IP development, porting and publishing. In 2022, they expect to launch 8 titles across all major game consoles.

david_murphy.bio: Murph is Chief Architect for Red Hat Ireland; A tinkerer from a young age, he has over 30 years of experience taking things apart and putting them back together in interesting ways. A full-stack enthusiast, he has interest and experience ranging from 8-bit breadboard computers to open source game engines to JavaScript-based business apps for the web - with stops at every tech along the way.

grania_ohare.bio: Grania O’Hare is the Co-lead of Mastercard PRIDE business resource group, and former LGBT leader with IBM. Graduate of UCD in law, and computer science. With extensive experience in technical communications and content operations, her career extends over several industries including aeronautics, telecoms, healthcare, and finance technology.

forum_mehta.bio: Forum joined Google in November 2020 as a Technical Program Manager. Prior to that, she worked with GameStop and Blueface as Business Analyst. She completed her Masters in Information Systems from UCD in 2019. As a technical Program Manager, Forum is responsible for running a project from its inception to execution.
